sentences: Trots on noortele omane, kuigi nad alati ei teagi, mida nad trotsivad.
context: Nemad is the Estonian third-person plural pronoun 'they' in the nominative case. The short form of this pronoun is 'nad'. It refers to people or beings who are neither the speaker nor the listener. The word can decline into various forms including nende (genitive), neid (partitive), nendes/neis (inessive), nendele/neile (allative), and others depending on grammatical case requirements.
